featured.text: Arms extending horizontally commanded drivers to stop, whereas arms lowered to a 45-degree angle told drivers to move on, resembling a traffic director’s gestures.
V2I could also request traffic information from a traffic management system and access the best possible routes.
It was caused by a traffic accident.
I was held up by a traffic jam on the freeway for about an hour.

other.text: The inventors of traffic lights in history.
that John ________ escaped being killed in a traffic accident.
Which of the following pictures shows Knight’s proposed traffic signal?

Another new technology being tested is Vehicle-to-Infrastructure communication, or V2I. V2I would allow vehicles to communicate with road signs or traffic signals and provide information to the vehicle about safety issues.
As a record number of fans showed up for the baseball final, the highways around the stadium were with traffic all day.
The functions of different traffic signals.
Which of the following statements is true, according to the passage? (A) Knight was injured in the explosion of his traffic light.
The traffic in the city was today, so Jane got home earlier than usual.
Most people credit the first traffic light to Nottingham engineer John Peake Knight.
If you _____ a traffic law, such as drinking and driving, you may not drive for some time.
The first traffic signal originated from the idea of a traffic director.
The traffic department of the government. 55.
How did the traffic accident ? (A) come about (B) come around (C) come off (D) come over 13.
When Mike enters the living room, (C) the traffic and the noise bothered him greatly. 19.
Knight’s traffic signal was installed near London’s Westminster Bridge in December 1868, but the system was short-lived.
The evolution of traffic control systems.
What does “infrastructure” in Vehicle-to-Infrastructure refer to? (A) Traffic facilities and information systems.
Here is a sentence: “This design was adopted in later traffic light designs across the world.”
Deemed a public hazard, the project was immediately dropped, and traffic lights were banned until their return in 1929 back to the British streets.
In the early 1900s, versions of the British traffic lights appeared in big cities in America, where traffic was on a sharp rise.
More and more new cars can reverse-park, read traffic signs, maintain a safe distance in steady traffic and brake automatically to avoid crashes.
Now, with the emergence of self-driving cars, researchers have begun to suggest that traffic signals are no longer necessary.

definition.zh_def: 交通，指的是人或物在道路上移動的情況。
definition.en_def: The movement of vehicles and people along roads.
definition.example: The traffic was heavy during rush hour.
